intro: Seseli puberulum, commonly known as the woolly seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Seseli puberulum is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
